paintingLabel: Ritratto di Lunia Czechowska con ventaglio

abstract: Worker and Kolkhoz Woman (Russian: Рабо́чий и колхо́зница, tr. Rabóchy i kolkhóznitsa) is a sculpture of two figures with a sickle and a hammer raised over their heads. It is 24.5 meters (78 feet) high, made from stainless steel by Vera Mukhina for the 1937 World's Fair in Paris, and subsequently moved to Moscow. The sculpture is an example of socialist realism in an Art Deco aesthetic. The worker holds aloft a hammer and the kolkhoz woman a sickle to form the hammer and sickle symbol.\n\n
